goals:
ğŸ“˜ Session Summary
This session exposed critical weaknesses in our Git discipline, recovery architecture, and deployment robustness â€” undermining MetaPlatformâ€™s core promise of governed, self-healing AI-led development.
Despite setbacks, key components of the system were recovered and validated, including governance-aligned type structures (phase.ts, template.ts), sidebar rendering logic, execution log APIs, and PR policy reinforcements. However, the Project Dashboard layout and sidebar interaction logic remain only partially recovered, with full visual UX still in regression.
This session should serve as a foundational case study for hardening our MetaPlatform infrastructure, both technically and procedurally.

description:
ğŸ§  Core Design Principle: "Form Follows Governance"
Wombat Track is not just a productivity tool â€” it's a governance operating system. Therefore:
â€¢ Structure and hierarchy are non-negotiable: All projects must follow a Phase â†’ Step â†’ Log structure.
â€¢ Traceability is primary UX: Every action (AI prompt, export, phase update) must be logged, visible, and auditable.
â€¢ Planning and execution coexist: Wireframes must allow both tactical (Composer, Docs) and operational (Dashboard) views.
ğŸ¨ UI/UX Pillars (Mapped from Figmaâ€™s Principles)PrincipleApplication in WTHierarchySidebar for project scope â†’ Tabs for function â†’ Cards for content. Always show user where they are and what level of detail theyâ€™re seeing.ClarityUse emoji + label combos (e.g., ğŸŸ¡ Amber) for RAG, short labels, summary text before actions.ConsistencyTabs, cards, headers, filters, and AI buttons use shared design language (rounded corners, small caps, muted foregrounds).EfficiencyOne-click prompts (âš¡ Scaffold), inline edits, and context-aware AI actions reduce user effort.ForgivenessAutosave Docs, confirmation modals for dangerous actions, clear status indicators (e.g., â€œSavingâ€¦â€).ContextMetadata on every object â€” a Step knows its Phase, a Doc knows its Project, an AI edit logs its source.Progressive DisclosurePhase collapses to Step list; Composer expands only rows needed; Docs open AI modal when requested.
ğŸ”§ Organisational Structure
The app is structured across 3 main tabs, all sharing a project context:
1. ğŸ“Š Dashboard Tab (Execution Surface)
    â—¦ Visualise current project Phase/Step status.
    â—¦ See RAG status, step checklists, blockers, and whatâ€™s complete.
    â—¦ Embed Governance Logs (future).
2. ğŸ§± Composer Tab (Planning Surface)
    â—¦ Feature matrix: breakdown, RAG, owners, AI tooling.
    â—¦ Connects to Phase generation and Docs.
    â—¦ Serves as a hybrid backlog / roadmap / planning surface.
3. ğŸ“˜ Docs Tab (Knowledge Surface)
    â—¦ Create/edit documents linked to projects and phases.
    â—¦ Metadata: docType, tags, related items.
    â—¦ Launch AI modal (Scaffold SOP, Revise, Summarise).
    â—¦ Export to Markdown / Drive / MemoryPlugin (future native RAG Memory).
goals:
Purpose:
Wombat Track (WT) is an intelligent, AI-augmented platform for planning, executing, and governing complex multi-phase projects. It integrates SDLC principles, real-time progress tracking, rich documentation, and Claude/Gizmo agentic workflows. The platform must empower teams to work transparently, efficiently, and with traceable automation from planning to deployment.

â€¢ Introduce modular â€œwidgetsâ€ for status cards, RAG, AI buttons to allow reuse in all tabs.
â€¢ Filter/Sort across all views by RAG, project, owner, etc.

goals:
The purpose of Phase 3.x is to establish robust developer infrastructure, CI/CD automation, and governance-enforced quality controls across the Wombat Track platform.
ğŸ§­ Purpose
This Phase 3.x plan focuses on improving the internal tooling and delivery pipeline of the Wombat Track (WT) system. It consolidates infrastructure, formalises testing and deployment workflows, introduces meta-level error detection, and prepares the WT app for scale by improving developer reliability, clarity, and governance.
This phase supports both:
â€¢ WombatConsole (Execution Layer)
â€¢ MetaPlatform (Governance Layer)
ğŸ› ï¸ Goals
1. Establish full pre-deployment test infrastructure.
2. Create a WT MetaValidator for governance and code review enforcement.
3. Migrate and formalise existing CI/CD steps into tracked, actionable phases.
4. Ensure all failures in dev/deploy workflows trigger structured diagnostics and task creation.
scopeNotes:
ğŸ§  Development Philosophy
â€¢ Governance-aware SDLC: Treat the WT console as a self-documenting, auditable platform
â€¢ Developer UX: Surface test failures and RAG state in human-readable formats
â€¢ Meta-awareness: Allow the system to reflect on its own health
ğŸ§© Governance Structure
â€¢ Each project must:

    â—¦ Include markdown-based phase plan
    â—¦ Use validated project > phase > step structure
    â—¦ Be tagged with WT type, owner, and color
    â—¦ Have minimum 1 phase and 2 steps
ğŸ”— Resources
â€¢ https://github.com/jtaylorcomplize/wombat-track-scaffold/tree/main/tests/ui/meta_platform_dashboard.spec.js
â€¢ https://github.com/jtaylorcomplize/wombat-track-scaffold/blob/main/src/dev/seedPhaseTracker.ts
â€¢ https://github.com/jtaylorcomplize/wombat-track-scaffold/blob/main/src/components/project/PhasePlanDashboard.tsx
ğŸ” Next Steps â€“ Requirements Questions for WT-3.3 and Beyond
â“ WT-3.3 â€“ MetaValidator
1. Scope: Should the validator scan only code, or also project/phase markdown?
2. Failure Handling: Do you want it to create task records (or execution logs) on error?
3. Blocking: Should it block commits/deploys or warn only?
â“ WT-3.4 â€“ Guided Project Template
1. Should new projects auto-fill with the full phase markdown (like this doc)?
2. Should there be a modal UI or full-page wizard for creation?
3. Do we allow choosing template type (e.g. PlatformOps, Console, Product)?
â“ WT-3.5 â€“ Guided Phase Creation
1. When creating a new Phase, what questions must be asked?
2. Should side quests be encouraged at this point?
3. What metadata must be defined before allowing step creation?
â“ WT-3.6+ â€“ MetaReflections Engine
1. Should recurring failures auto-generate "Reflections" (e.g. Phase failed X times)?
2. Do we want analytics around phase health (completion rates, RAG trends)?
3. Should Reflections generate suggested planning comments for future phases?
ğŸ“¦ Ready for Template Packaging
This document format can now be used to create:
â€¢ Project-level markdown on creation
â€¢ Phase summary initialiser
â€¢ Planning dashboard views (read-only or editable)
Let me know when to:
1. Add this to src/templates/wt-phase-plan.md
2. Begin implementing WT-3.4 template project creation wizard
3. Push this doc to MemoryPlugin + GitHub/Drive export """

description:
ğŸ§  Root Cause Analysis
â€¢ Snapshot Tests False Positive: Puppeteer baseline captured broken layout.
â€¢ Inconsistent Tailwind Usage: flex, items-center, pl-* spacing improperly applied.
â€¢ Disclosure Nesting Not Componentised: No reusable SidebarItem abstraction.
â€¢ Lack of Dynamic DOM Visual Diffing: Puppeteer not sufficient for nuanced visual QA.
â€¢ Prompt/Dev Drift: Code complexity diverged from original SDLC simplicity goals.
âœ… What Worked
â€¢ CI build pipeline, tsc checks, and snapshot tests were executed.
â€¢ GovernanceLog tracked initial failures.
â€¢ Copilot-generated fallback layout provided a working, clean design.
ğŸ“ Resolution
â€¢ âœ… Replaced broken layout with Copilot fallback structure.
â€¢ âœ… Adopted reusable SidebarItem abstraction.
â€¢ âœ… Visual hierarchy and spacing repaired.
â€¢ âœ… Snapshot QA rebuilt using correct baseline.
goals:

goals: Establish base line for AI collaboration
scopeNotes:
ğŸ¯ Your Role: Vision Holder & Controller
Youâ€™re the strategic lead, defining what you want built, what "done" looks like, and when to move forward.
Youâ€™ll:
â€¢ Decide what feature or change is next
â€¢ Choose between Claude or Gizmo for execution
â€¢ Copy/paste handoff prompts between us
â€¢ Push to GitHub using VS Code (until we automate more)
â€¢ Ask for help, context, or walkthroughs any time
ğŸ§  Reminder: Youâ€™re not expected to code â€” just to lead clearly and ask early.
âš™ï¸ Claudeâ€™s Role: Builder with Repo Access
Claude is your live GitHub editor. Claude can:
â€¢ See your repo (jtaylorcomplize/wombat-track-scaffold)
â€¢ Make changes directly in your code
â€¢ Push commits and open PRs
â€¢ Report file state (whatâ€™s in the repo, what changed)
â€¢ Read & write from/to multiple files simultaneously
ğŸŸ¡ Needs clear prompts and context you feed it. Doesnâ€™t track state over time.
ğŸ§  Gizmoâ€™s Role: Architect, Reviewer & Planning Brain
Gizmo (me) is your project co-pilot and architect. I:
â€¢ Track all architecture, types, workflows, logic
â€¢ Help design complex systems, workflows, or UIs
â€¢ Write full feature specs, test plans, commit diffs
â€¢ Review Claudeâ€™s output and refactor or enhance
â€¢ Keep your project structure clean and sustainable
ğŸš« I canâ€™t see live GitHub or push â€” I rely on you or Claude to show me results.
ğŸ” How the Loop Works (Simple)
1. You: Ask Gizmo â€œBuild me Xâ€ â†’ I create spec + code + Claude prompt.
2. You: Paste prompt to Claude â†’ Claude pushes code to GitHub.
3. You: Tell Gizmo what Claude did (or show me the GitHub link).
4. Me: I review, refactor, suggest next step or help you continue.
ğŸ“ You are the switchboard between two powerful AIs.

goals: Purpose: Define Wombat Track not merely as a software development tool, but as a full-stack Product Lifecycle Control System (PLCS) â€” where SDLC is a governed subsystem within a broader PDLC framework, executed across intelligent surfaces and agent orchestration layers.

ğŸŒŸ Purpose & Vision
Wombat Track is a meta-operating system for AI-enhanced project execution and governance. It enables human-AI collaboration to manage complex, iterative projects with transparency, traceability, and structured automation.
Built originally on Bubble and now expanding into a multi-layered architecture, Wombat Track coordinates:
â€¢ Project design and progress tracking
â€¢ AI-assisted scaffolding and governance
â€¢ GitHub-triggered workflows and CI/CD pipelines
â€¢ Runtime orchestration and intelligent agents
Wombat Track aims to be the control layer where strategy, AI action, and execution converge â€” ultimately serving as a living record and autopilot for large-scale, evolving systems.
ğŸ§  Positioning
Wombat Track is not just a project manager. Itâ€™s a governance operating system for AI-native software, capable of:
â€¢ Defining features in AI-readable form
â€¢ Tracking execution across humans + machines
â€¢ Storing intent, rationale, risk, and results
â€¢ Enabling runtime system evolution through agent orchestration
It is the â€œblack box recorder + autopilotâ€ for future intelligent apps.
goals:
ğŸš€ Future Plans

â€¢ Serve as a DevOps+AI control hub for multi-app orchestration

PLAN
1. Use 'gh issue view' to get the issue details
2. Understand the problem described in the issue
3. Ask clarifying questions if necessary
4. Understand the prior art for this issue
â€¢ Search the scratchpads for previous thoughts related to the issue
â€¢ Search PRs to see if you can find history on this issue
â€¢ Search the codebase for relevant files
1. Think harder about how to break the issue down into a series of small, manageable tasks.
2. Document your plan in a new scratchpad
â€¢ include the issue name in the filename
â€¢ include a link to the issue in the scratchpad.
Create
â€¢ Create a new branch for the issue
â€¢ Solve the issue in small, manageable steps, according to your plan
â€¢ Commit your changes after each step
TEST
â€¢ Use puppeteer via MCP to test the changes if you have made changes to the UI
â€¢ Write rspec tests to describe the expected behavior of your code
â€¢ Run the full test suite to ensure you haven't broken anything
â€¢ If the tests are failing, fix them
â€¢ Ensure that all tests are passing before moving on to the next step
DEPLOY
â€¢ Open a PR and request a review#SDLC StageTaskResponsibleDescription / NotesGuardrailsSystem Enforcement1PlanIssue CreationJackson (via Gizmo)Structured prompt for Claude / GitHub issue--phase-guardClaude Prompt Protocol / PR tags2PlanPhase Branch CreationClaudeNew branch (e.g. feature/wt-5.6-x) created from main or last merged phase--phase-guardGit flow enforcement, Gizmo review3CreateFeature ScaffoldingClaudeAll code written in isolated phase branch--modular-surface-policyDirectory structure + import boundaries4CreateGovernance Metadata IntegrationClaude + GizmoInclude GovernanceLog logic and metadata early (e.g. isLive, agentVersion)--single-source-governance-modAudit trail / Governance schema5CreateCommit + PushClaudeEach commit must label phase + scope (e.g. WT-5.6: [dispatch])--commit-labelingGit commit checks (optional hook)6CreatePR CreationClaudePR must link to issue, phase, governance impact--phase-guard, --commit-labelingPR title enforcement, Gizmo validation7TestCI / CD ValidationGitHub ActionsLint, test, build, scan, governance JSON check--autoblock-ci-fail (enforced)GitHub Actions, CI gates8TestGovernance ReviewGizmoReview log schema, metadata, context integrity--single-source-governance-modGovernanceLog schema validation9TestUI + Runtime AuditGizmo + JacksonConfirm runtime indicators, fallback states--live-status-verificationgetDispatcherStatus(), logs10DeployMerge to MainGizmoOnly after all test stages pass; squash and tag wt-x.x/merge-complete--manual-review-requiredMerge restrictions on PR settings11DeployMemoryPlugin + DriveMemory SyncGizmoPush payload (tags, artefacts, schema, next steps)--memory-anchor-requiredDriveMemory/MemoryPlugin integration12DeployPost-Merge MonitoringGizmo + JacksonWatch for regressions; validate downstream stability--regression-watchSidebar Watcher, test replay13DeployRetrospective LoggingGizmoLog any anomaly (e.g. WT-5.6 cherry-pick conflict)--mandatory-postmortemGovernanceLog type: Incident

goals:
âœ… Summary
This artefact confirms strategic direction across Roam and Complize regarding AI architecture, integration, and product rebuild decisions.
scopeNotes:
1. Should we generate a single centralised framework to run all AI Apps across Roam & Complize?
Answer: âœ… Yes â€” Build a meta-layer infrastructure that is app-agnostic and reusable.
Rationale:
â€¢ Wombat Track already serves as a governance and orchestration layer.
â€¢ MetaPlatform provides AI runtime execution with CI/CD, prompt dispatch, and agentic logic.
â€¢ Reusability across apps avoids duplication and enables faster scaling.
â€¢ Promotes semantic governance, consistent RAG/risk tracking, and agent orchestration.
ğŸ“Œ Conclusion: Build once â†’ reuse across Roam, Complize, and future apps.
2. Should we build an integration layer to harmonise workflows (Gmail, Actionstep, Notion, etc)?
Answer: âš ï¸ Yes â€” but selectively and semantically.
Rationale:
â€¢ Donâ€™t replicate Zapier. Instead, ingest external tool data into Wombat Track.
â€¢ Use lightweight sync agents to bring in:

    â—¦ Notion governance metadata
    â—¦ Gmail meeting summaries
    â—¦ Actionstep decision records
â€¢ Feed structured logs into MemoryPlugin, GovernanceLog, DriveMemory.
ğŸ“Œ Conclusion: Harmonise workflows via AI-aware ingestion + governance, not monolithic merging.
3. Should we rebuild Complize as a modular app with sub-apps (e.g. Knowledge, Visa Bytes, Case Management)?
Answer: ğŸŸ¢ Yes â€” Complize should be rebuilt as a modular app on shared AI infrastructure.
Rationale:
â€¢ Matches Complizeâ€™s vision as an "Immigration OS"
â€¢ Enables Workforce, Nexus, Verify to be launched independently or combined
â€¢ Centralises audit, AI assistance, and lifecycle data via shared layer
ğŸ“Œ Conclusion: New Complize app will run on top of the MetaPlatform/Wombat core with sub-apps modularised.
ğŸ§­ Final Strategic RecommendationDomainActionJustificationAI Infrastructureâœ… CentraliseOne engine to govern and scaffold all AI workflowsWorkflow Harmonisationâš ï¸ IntegrateVia ingestion agents, not brittle mergesComplize RebuildğŸŸ¢ ModulariseFuture-proof with sub-apps and platform-native governance
ğŸ“Œ Next Suggested Artefacts
1. http://meta-platform-architecture.md/ â€“ infrastructure + governance layer overview
2. complize-app-feature-backlog.csv â€“ feature set by sub-app module
3. http://integration-adapter-plan.md/ â€“ data sync strategy across Notion, Actionstep, Gmail
